title: Deep unrolling for learning optimal spatially varying regularisation parameters for Total Generalised Variation
author: Thanh Trung Vu (University of Cambridge), Andreas Kofler (Physikalisch-Technische Bundesanstalt), Kostas Papafitsoros (Queen Mary University of London), ...
relevance_why: The methods introduced in this paper can potentially enhance audio quality through improved image denoising techniques applicable in various audio-visual contexts.
background: This paper addresses inverse imaging problems by optimizing the regularization parameters in image reconstruction, particularly focusing on maintaining image structures effectively during the reconstruction process.
contribution: This paper introduces a framework that combines deep learning with unrolled optimization methods to learn spatially varying regularization parameters in Total Generalised Variation, achieving superior results in image denoising and MRI reconstruction.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods typically used scalar parameters for regularization in Total Variation models, leading to suboptimal results in preserving image quality.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work integrates convolutional neural networks for parameter learning along with an unrolled algorithmic scheme, which allows for adaptive and spatially varying regularization, producing better reconstruction outcomes.

key_innovation: Employs deep learning to dynamically optimize regularization parameters that vary spatially, allowing for better preservation of structural details like edges in reconstructed images.
real_world_impact: The framework demonstrates promising improvements in imaging tasks, which could translate to better analysis and diagnostic capabilities in medical imaging and enhanced multimedia experiences.
limitations: No specific limitations are mentioned in the paper.

new_terms.Total Generalised Variation: **Total Generalised Variation (TGV)** is a higher-order regularization approach in image processing that handles the preservation of edges and fine details while smoothing out homogeneous regions.
new_terms.Banach space: **Banach space** refers to a complete normed vector space, where every Cauchy sequence converges within the space.

open_sourcing: The code for the experiments can be found at https://github.com/trung-vt/LearningRegularizationParametersForTGV
